metadata.title: CVE-2018-1000532 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
beep version 1.3 and up contains a External Control of File Name or Pathvulnerability in --device option that can result in Local unprivileged usercan inhibit execution of arbitrary programs by other users, allowing DoS.This attack appear to be exploitable via The system must allow local usersto run beep.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000532` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

beep - 1.4.3-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: beep package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.3-2').
